Description: Fragment of solid-cast figure in copper alloy; only lower part preserved; two human feet together, toes marked, standing on a rounded rectangular base with a tang protruding from its underside; probably belonging to a figure of an Egyptian goddess; broken off at ankles and tang partially broken off; corroded with incrustations.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Bolton Museum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Topic of the figure impossible to determine.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (MB.258) (phase 3)
Acquisition notes: Presented by the EEF, received from R.S. Poole Esq., 16 June 1886
